t: Brazil’s Amazon rainforest is burning at a record rate | CNN
s: August 23, 2019 - Fires are raging at a record rate in Brazil’s Amazon rainforest, and scientists warn that it could strike a devastating blow to the fight against climate change.

s: August 22, 2019 - The Amazon is on fire, but there are still ways to help.

t: Amazon rainforest fires rage in sobering views from space - CNET
s: August 22, 2019 - Satellites are tracking a record number of wildfires burning across Brazil's rainforest.

t: Satellites Show Thousands Of Fires Sweeping Through Brazil's Amazon Rainforest : NPR
s: August 22, 2019 - Fires are always burning in the Amazon. But wildfires have surged 83% since this time last year, according to Brazil's space agency. Satellites have spotted more than 9,500 wildfires this past week.

t: Amazon wants to launch thousands of satellites so it can offer broadband internet from space
s: April 4, 2019 - Known as Project Kuiper, the move represents the latest space ambition from Jeff Bezos. Amazon has previously announced its cloud business will build a network of satellite facilities on Earth and Bezos' space venture Blue Origin continues to move closer to launching space tourists.

t: Amazon launches first two satellites in planned orbital internet service | Satellites | The Guardian

t: Amazon builds US$120 million satellite processing hub - iTnews
s: July 24, 2023 - Amazon is building a US$120 million ($178 million) processing facility at NASA's Kennedy Space Center in Florida for its thousands of planned Kuiper internet satellites.

t: Amazon launches its first internet satellites | Information Age | ACS
s: October 9, 2023 - Saturday’s launch saw two prototype satellites delivered into space aboard an Atlas V rocket designed and operated by United Launch Alliance (ULA), a joint venture between aerospace companies Lockheed Martin and Boeing. Project Kuiper is an initiative to increase global broadband access through a constellation of 3,236 satellites in low Earth orbit (LEO). Its mission is to bring fast, affordable broadband to unserved and underserved communities around the world.

t: Amazon launches first Kuiper internet satellites, taking on Starlink | Reuters
s: April 29, 2025 - The first 27 satellites for Amazon's Kuiper broadband internet constellation were launched into space from Florida on Monday, kicking off the long-delayed deployment of an internet-from-space network that will rival SpaceX's Starlink.

t: Amazon’s Project Kuiper set for first full-scale satellite launch
s: United Launch Alliance will send 27 Kuiper satellites into low Earth orbit as we begin a full-scale deployment of our satellite internet network.

18 hours ago - On July 30, 2020, the Federal Communications Commission granted Amazon approval to deploy a constellation of 3,236 satellites into low Earth orbit. Deployment is planned in five phases, and internet service will begin once the first 578 satellites are launched.
